article_title: Justices Float ACA Birth Control Compromise
article_text:
Justices Float ACA Birth Control Compromise

Law360, New York (March 29, 2016, 2:53 PM ET) -- In an unusual move, the U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday directed the Obama administration and religious nonprofits to explore a potential compromise to their long-running fight over the Affordable Care Act’s contraception mandate.



Supporters of birth control access rally outside the U.S. Supreme Court on March 23 as the court hears oral arguments in Zubik v. Burwell. (Credit: AP) In a two-page order on Tuesday, justices ordered the opposing sides to file briefs addressing whether contraceptives could be supplied to employees of the religious nonprofits without...
